About.title: Czech National Record Holder
About.description: Daniel Mitka, a 16-year-old elite swimmer from SK Motorlet Praha, has achieved remarkable success in Czech swimming. His standout achievement is setting a national record as part of the mixed 4x50m medley relay at the 2022 Winter Championships in Mladá Boleslav. Competing at the highest national level, Daniel contributes every year to the performance and overall success of SK Motorlet Praha. With his proven track record in competitive swimming, he is now focused on joining the Colorado Hilltoppers team while pursuing his studies in the USA.

projects.title: My Love Website
projects.description: A romantic website counting days together with interactive hearts and beautiful animations.

story.title: The Championship Story
story.paragraph1: At the prestigious 2024 Lifesaving World Championships in Gold Coast, Australia, Daniel Mitka demonstrated exceptional prowess in multiple disciplines, proudly representing the Czech Republic in the junior category.
story.highlight: The championship's pinnacle moment came with securing the silver medal in the Line Throw event, where Daniel and Adam Pekař's perfect synchronization showcased Czech excellence on the international stage.
story.paragraph2: This achievement represents not just individual skill, but the culmination of years of dedicated training and teamwork that has placed Czech lifesaving on the world map.

achievements.description: Outperforming teams from New Zealand and South Africa

story.title: Elite Team Championship
story.paragraph1: The Team Championship Finals in Ostrava represents the pinnacle of Czech club swimming, where only the best teams advance after rigorous semifinal competitions. Motorlet Praha earned their place through exceptional performances in earlier rounds.
story.quote: We advance to the finals, which will be held on March 22-23 in Ostrava - celebrating the successful semifinal campaign that brought both men's and women's teams to the elite level.
story.paragraph2: The finals showcased Daniel's versatility across multiple disciplines, contributing crucial points to Motorlet Praha's overall team success in this prestigious competition.

events.description: All four strokes combined - best individual result

eventVideos.title: Event Videos
eventVideos.videoDescription: Watch Daniel's performance in the {event} at the Team Championship Finals in Ostrava. Final time: {time}, earning {points} and finishing {placement}.

highlights.title: Championship Impact
highlights.description: The Team Championship Finals in Ostrava showcased the strength of Czech club swimming, with Motorlet Praha achieving solid results across both men's and women's divisions. Daniel's contribution across four individual events demonstrated his versatility and commitment to team success.

story.title: International Experience
story.paragraph1: The Slovakia Cup in Šamorín on October 25, 2024, was a showcase of versatility where Daniel Mitka competed across five different swimming events, demonstrating technical proficiency in both freestyle and individual medley disciplines.
story.highlight: Standout performances included a strong 100m freestyle time of 0:52.82 and consistent individual medley swims across 100m, 200m, and 400m distances, showing excellent stroke technique and endurance.
story.paragraph2: The competition featured multiple events ranging from sprint distances to challenging 400m individual medley, testing both speed and technical mastery across all four competitive swimming strokes.

eventsList.description: Personal best in all four swimming strokes

story.title: National Competition Excellence
story.paragraph1: The Czech National Swimming Championship (MCR) in Podolí represents the pinnacle of domestic swimming competition, where the nation's best swimmers compete for national titles and records.
story.highlight: Competing at this level demands not only technical excellence but also mental fortitude to perform under the pressure of representing your region at the highest national standard.
story.paragraph2: This championship serves as a crucial stepping stone for international competitions and demonstrates Daniel's commitment to achieving excellence in Czech swimming.

eventsList.description: Heats: 2:11.91 | Finals: 2:11.92 - All four strokes combined
Heats: 2:00.50 | Finals: 1:57.72 - Excellent improvement in finals

highlights.title: Championship Experience
highlights.description: The Czech National Swimming Championship in Podolí provided an invaluable opportunity to compete against the country's elite swimmers in a world-class facility.

story.title: International Swimming Competition
story.paragraph1: The Plzen Czech Open Championship represents one of the most prestigious international swimming competitions in the Czech Republic, attracting elite swimmers from across Europe. The event showcases the highest level of competitive swimming with exceptional performances.
story.quote: Competing against international talent in Plzen provided invaluable experience and opportunities to test skills against Europe's finest swimmers.
story.paragraph2: Daniel demonstrated remarkable versatility and determination throughout the competition, achieving personal bests and contributing to Motorlet Praha's strong international presence.
